qas.question: Who was the 'father of modern policing'?
What political position did Bentham think police should have?
Who was the 'mother of modern policing'?
What political position did Bentham think police shouldn't have?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Peel<b5_0/><a0_0/>, widely regarded as the father of modern policing, was heavily influenced by the social and legal philosophy of <a1_0><b6_0>Jeremy Bentham<b6_0/><a1_0/>, who called for a strong and centralized, but politically <a2_0><b7_0>neutral<b7_0/><a2_0/>, police force for the maintenance of social order, for the protection of people from crime and to act as a visible deterrent to urban crime and disorder. Peel decided to standardise the police force <a3_0><b8_0>as an official paid profession<b8_0/><a3_0/>, to organise it <a4_0><b9_0>in a civilian fashion<b9_0/><a4_0/>, and to make it answerable to the public.
